definition: things turn out contrary to the way one wishes (idiom)
to disobey/to violate/to separate/to go against

sentences.english: Dr. Cutler’s research suggests that this is self-defeating behavior.
sentences.chinese: 卡特勒博士的研究表明这是一种事与愿违的行为。

sentences.english: Also, this is why changing menus dynamically sometimes backfires .
sentences.chinese: 这就是为什么动态地改变菜单有时候事与愿违。

sentences.english: It hasn't been: Apple sold 9.25 million iPads last quarter.
sentences.chinese: 然而事与愿违，上季度iPad售出925万台。

sentences.english: However, this approach can back fire if it triggers a price-cutting spiral.
sentences.chinese: 然而事与愿违的是，这条途径可能引发商家竞相降价。

sentences.english: That may change the North’s behavior, but it could backfire.
sentences.chinese: 这有可能改变北韩的行为，但是也可能事与愿违。

sentences.english: Many things in our lives go by contraries .
sentences.chinese: 我们生活中有许多事与愿违的情况。

sentences.english: Among other personality types, this compensation usually backfires .
sentences.chinese: 在其它的人格类型中，这种补偿通常会事与愿违。
如果魔鬼训练事与愿违咋办？

sentences.english: Many things in our lives go by - ries.
sentences.chinese: 生活中的许多事情都是事与愿违。

sentences.english: Instead, he said, people got "a whimper, not a scream."
sentences.chinese: 事与愿违，人们报之以“呜咽，而非惊叫”。

sentences.english: Counterproductive, who is cruel to hurt someone?
sentences.chinese: 缐事与愿违，是谁狠心伤害了谁？

sentences.english: Honesty is a friend of you, partner of hypocrisy is counterproductive.
sentences.chinese: 诚信是心想事成的朋友，虚伪是事与愿违的伴侣。

sentences.english: His plan backfired on him, and he lost all his money.
sentences.chinese: 他的计划事与愿违，因此他的钱全亏掉了。

sentences.english: And if things truly are against you, see No. 8.
sentences.chinese: 然而如果事情真地都事与愿违，那么看第8点。

sentences.english: And it has had other untoward effects.
sentences.chinese: 而且它还有其他事与愿违的效应。

definition: God's plans supersede our own/Man proposes but God disposes
pinyin: ren2 suan4 bu4 ru2 tian1 suan4

definition: a good thing doesn't last forever (idiom)
lit. to ruin the enterprise for the sake of one basketful/to fail through lack of a final effort/to spoil the ship for a ha'penny worth of tar (idiom)
it is a pity/what a pity/unfortunately
to run in the opposite direction (idiom); to run counter to
to rush to conclude a matter/to end up abruptly
lit. Cheng Yaojin ambushes the enemy (saying)/fig. sb shows up unexpectedly and disrupts the plan/sb whose presence is regarded as irksome
pinyin: ban4 lu4 sha1 chu1 ge4 Cheng2 Yao3 jin1

definition: to produce the opposite of the desired result
the road to happiness is strewn with setbacks (idiom)
